required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Follicular Versus Luteal Pipelle in Repeated Implantation Failure Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
Pipelle was found to increase pregnancy and implantation rates in women undergoing IVF treatment in general, and in particular in repeated implantation failure (RIF). However, there is virtually no data regarding the optimal timing for the pipelle.
The current study aims to compare between follicular and luteal pipelle on pregnancy rate in RIF patients.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective

study_pop.textblock: Women diagnosed with repeated implantation failure (RIF) who are undergoing IVF treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Women diagnosed with RIF who are going to start a new IVF treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
Known hydrosalpinx body mass index (BMI) >29 kg/m2 or <18 kg/m2 Low ovarian response

overall_official.affiliation: Assaf Harofeh Medical Center, Zerifin, Israel
